snippet: A 45-minute brotherly chat in Houston on Monday capped a two-day exercise in reminders that — at least for those gathered — the Bush name has retained its galvanizing charm.
abstract: Republican presidential hopeful Jeb Bush, who is sliding in polls, takes stage in Houston alongside his brother, former President George W Bush; languishing poll numbers and wide-scale campaign upheaval may be behind move to reinforce image of Bush family's history and charm.
lead_paragraph: A 45-minute brotherly chat in Houston on Monday capped a two-day exercise in reminders that — at least for those gathered — the Bush name has retained its galvanizing charm.

headline.print_headline: Bushes Put on a Family Show of Reassurance Amid Campaign Upheaval
headline.main: Bushes Put On Family Show of Reassurance Amid Campaign Upheaval
